Key Match Events: Jacob Stallings hit an RBI double in the ninth inning to help the Colorado Rockies beat the Detroit Tigers 4-2.
Brendan Rodgers led off the ninth with a single off Jason Foley.
Nolan Jones moved to third on a groundout.
Jake Cave made it 4-2 with a long sacrifice fly.
Tyler Kinley pitched the ninth inning, retiring Zach McKinstry with runners at the corners for his 12th save.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers began the day three games behind the Minnesota Twins for the third American League wild-card spot.
The Rockies manager Bud Black said they had some good at-bats against Tigers ace Tarik Skubal.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said they struggled offensively and didn't really square up Rockies pitcher Ryan Feltner.
Skubal was hit in the right (non-pitching) hand by Brenton Doyle's line drive in the sixth inning.
Hinch said X-rays were negative but Skubal would have more tests on the hand.
Skubal said it's a little sore, but he's not worried about it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the end of an 11-day road trip for the Rockies.
The Rockies took a 1-0 lead on Jordan Beck's third-inning homer.
Spencer Torkelson put the Tigers ahead with a two-run double in the fourth.
Ezequiel Tovar nearly put the Rockies ahead in the fifth, but Riley Greene made a leaping catch at the wall to take away a two-run home run.
